alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 5:33PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Apache. * WHEN...Until 845 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 533 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Crazy Creek, Puerco River, Dead Wash, Wide Ruin Wash, Steamboat Wash, Pueblo Colorado Wash, Digger Wash, Lithodendron Wash, Sabito Wash and Big Dam Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sunrise Springs, Cornfields Chapter House, Petrified Forest National Park and Navajo Reservation. - This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 428 and 433. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
